an10.113:1.1: “Mendicants, you should know bad principles with bad results.
an10.113:1.2: And you should know good principles with good results.
an10.113:1.3: Knowing these things, your practice should follow the good principles with good results.
an10.113:2.1: And what are bad principles with bad results?
an10.113:2.2: Wrong view, wrong thought, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong mindfulness, wrong immersion, wrong knowledge, and wrong freedom.
an10.113:2.3: These are called bad principles with bad results.
an10.113:3.1: And what are good principles with good results?
an10.113:3.2: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom.
an10.113:3.3: These are called good principles with good results.
an10.113:4.1: ‘You should know bad principles with bad results.
an10.113:4.2: And you should know good principles with good results.
an10.113:4.3: Knowing these things, your practice should follow the good principles with good results.’
an10.113:4.4: That’s what I said, and this is why I said it.”
